text: on the west bank in occupied Palestinian
territory a routine arrest but the
Palestinian man being detained by
Israeli soldiers here is Farouk aside a
football referee on his way to take
charge of a game he never made it the
Palestinian presentation to FIFA
demanding Israel suspension from world
football also includes video these
troops arriving at Palestinian FA
Headquarters the charge the Israeli
occupation is strangling the Palestinian
game I would like to see the Israeli
Football Association coming up with a
clear-cut statement announcing such
behaviors but unfortunately the Israeli
Federation is not more than plastic
surgeon for the ugly face of the racist
pretend Israeli occupation Israel feels
it has a positive story to tell about
football events like this bring
Palestinian and Israeli children
together there are Arab players at most
top-flight Israeli clubs and in the
national team sports should bring people
together so it starts we don't need to
get involved in politics you know not
especially in sport because it is the
one of the only things to bring people
together there's not much you can bring
Muslim Christian Jewish to play and to
be in a good relationship football is
played on the west bank of course this
is a women's league match but part of
the Palestinian case is the teams from
Jewish settlements on these occupied
territories play in the Israeli league
in breach of FIFA rules Israel which
staged the UEFA under-21 final at this
stadium only two years ago says the move
against it at FIFA is part of a broader
political campaign but not really about
sport at all the Palestinian strategy is
internationalization that's bringing
grievances against Israel to different
global arenas it is a new phase in an
old diplomatic conflict and for now it's
the fate of Israeli football that hangs
in the balance
Kevin Connolly BBC News Jerusalem
